pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [a62dc0d2ff](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18037/commits/a62dc0d2ff46d4e149d3e803396981565a36d8f0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsFinitelySemisimple.unifEigenspace_eq_eigenspace`
`+ Module.End.unifEigenspace_restrict_eq_top`
`+ _root_.Submodule.inf_unifEigenspace`
`+ eq_iSup_inf_unifEigenspace`
`+ exists_hasEigenvalue_of_unifEigenspace_eq_top`
`+ iSup_maxGenEigenspace_eq_top`
`+ independent_unifEigenspace`
`+ inf_iSup_unifEigenspace`
`+ injOn_maxGenEigenspace`
`+ injOn_unifEigenspace`
`+ map_add_of_iInf_unifEigenspace_ne_bot_of_commute`
`+ map_smul_of_iInf_unifEigenspace_ne_bot`
`+ maxGenEigenspace_eq_genEigenspace_finrank`
`+ supIndep_antimono_fun`
`+ unifEigenspace_inf_le_add`
`+ unifEigenspace_le_smul`
`+ unifEigenspace_restrict`
`- iSup_genEigenspace_eq_genEigenspace_finrank`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@jcommelin your most recent commit message is `wip`, and I noticed that this was never marked `awaiting-author` after Ruben's review, but yet all the conversations are marked resolved. What is the status here?
That `wip` should have been `fix`. This is ready for review.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11525319185/job/32087343544)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11525319185/job/32087343351)
Makes sense overall, I think, though there's a few places where the proofs get somewhat more tedious. A few suggestions below as well.
Makes sense overall, I think, though there's a few places where the proofs get somewhat more tedious. A few suggestions below as well.

One could avoid so much contradiction with:
```suggestion
  suffices  , f.HasUnifEigenvalue  k by
    peel this with  h
    exact HasUnifEigenvalue.lt zero_lt_one h
  simp [HasUnifEigenvalue,  not_forall,  iSup_eq_bot, hf]
```

Probably can be
```suggestion
      suffices (l ' : )  l from (f.unifEigenspace ').mono this (hl ')
```

I think we prefer
```suggestion
  induction s using Finset.induction_on with
  | empty => apply Finset.supIndep_empty
  | @insert i s his IH hle =>
```

```suggestion
  suffices   (s : Finset R),   s  Disjoint (f.unifEigenspace  k)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(LinearAlgebra): use maxGenEigenspace instead of iSup over genEigenspace
